author: yahoo
title: 3 Stocks Displaying Considerable Momentum Heading into 2024
text:
Zacks 3 Stocks Displaying Considerable Momentum Heading into 2024 Read full article Derek Lewis December 29, 2023 at 2:17 AM · 3 min read
Amid the recent favorable price action within the market, several stocks are nearing or breaking 52-week highs, including Shopify SHOP, The Gap GPS, and StoneCo STNE.
And in addition to recent momentum, all three sport a favorable Zacks Rank, reflecting upward earnings estimate revisions among analysts. Let’s take a closer look at each for those who like to tap into relative strength.
Shopify
Shopify shares have been monster performers in 2023, up more than 100% amid a broader rebound for growth stocks overall.
The company has seen positive earnings estimate revisions across multiple timeframes, landing it into the highly-coveted Zacks Rank #1 (Strong Buy).
Zacks Investment Research
Image Source: Zacks Investment Research
Shopify’s growth expectations are impossible to ignore, with consensus expectations for its current year (FY23) suggesting 1650% earnings growth on 25% higher sales. Peeking ahead to FY24, consensus estimates allude to a further 50% earnings growth paired with a 20% sales bump.
The Gap
With more than 3,800 stores worldwide, The Gap is a premier international specialty retailer offering a diverse range of clothing, accessories, and personal care products. Like SHOP, analysts have raised their earnings expectations across the board in a big way.
Zacks Investment Research
Image Source: Zacks Investment Research
Investors also stand to reap an income stream from GPS shares, currently yielding a solid 2.8% annually. Still, it’s worth noting that the company’s payout hasn’t increased for some time, perhaps steering away those with an income-focused approach.
The company has consistently blown away quarterly expectations as of late, exceeding the Zacks Consensus EPS Estimate by an average of 140% across its last four releases. Just in its latest print, GPS posted a 190% EPS beat and reported revenue 4% ahead of the consensus.
Shares saw a considerable boost post-earnings, as we can see illustrated below by the green arrow.
Zacks Investment Research
Image Source: Zacks Investment Research
StoneCo
StoneCo, a current Zacks Rank #1 (Strong Buy), offers an end-to-end cloud-based technology platform to conduct electronic commerce across in-store, online, and mobile channels. Analysts have taken their earnings expectations higher across all timeframes.
Story continues Zacks Investment Research
Image Source: Zacks Investment Research
Like SHOP, it’s hard to ignore the company’s growth profile, with earnings forecasted to climb 170% in its current year on 10% higher sales. Peeking ahead to FY24, consensus expectations suggest an additional 35% of earnings growth paired with a 13% revenue increase.
Shares aren’t overly expensive given the forecasted growth, with the current 21.1X forward earnings multiple well beneath the 42.5X five-year median and highs of 140.2X in 2020. The stock sports a Style Score of “C” for Value.
Zacks Investment Research
Image Source: Zacks Investment Research
Bottom Line
Relative strength investing is all about riding the trend. And when you add in rising earnings estimate revisions, these stocks have the fuel needed to continue climbing.
For those seeking stocks with strong momentum and a brightened earnings outlook, all three above – Shopify SHOP, The Gap GPS, and StoneCo STNE – fit the criteria nicely.

title: Kinder entdecken das Leben in der Stadt
text:

author: CLÁUBER ALBRES SILVA
title: Estudantes do Curso de História participam de aula de campo
text:
No dia 30 de novembro, acadêmicos do Curso de História da UFMS/CPAQ participaram de uma aula de campo com o objetivo de vivenciar experiências de Educação Patrimonial. Foram visitados Museu de Arqueologia da UFMS, Museu das Culturas Dom Bosco e Bioparque Pantanal.
Parte das Acadêmicas e dos Acadêmicos do Curso de História nunca haviam ido em um espaço de memória, como por exemplo um museu e ainda nunca tinham realizado uma visita guiada/mediada por um educador/a.
Nesse sentido, a Aula de Campo permitiu que vivenciassem questões que são discutidas em sala de aula como as vinculadas ao Patrimônio Cultural e a Educação Patrimonial, bem como oportunizou que as acadêmicas e acadêmicos do Curso de História pensassem em sua futura prática como professoras e professores de História.
Conforme a Coordenadora da ação, Ana Paula Squinelo: “A Aula de Campo é uma ação relevante na medida em que oportuniza a aluna e ao aluno acessar espaços que a sala de aula não acessa ou mesmo que as alunas e os alunos não tem oportunidade na vida cotidiana. É necessário criar uma cultura de que os espaços de memória são públicos e nos pertencem, contam a nossa história e, por isso, é relevante que nos apropriemos dos mesmos”.
“Eu sempre vi os Museus como espaço para gente chique… hoje eu estou me sentindo assim: chique! E entendi que é o Museu é para todes!”, disse Thais, acadêmica do 6° semestre do Curso de História.
Clique aqui para acessar alguns registros da ação.

author: Get News
title: Astir Home Health Care Reinforces Its Dedication to Premier Home Health Care in Bloomfield, NJ | User | theeveningleader.com
text:
Astir Home Health Care in Bloomfield, NJ, pledges to continue providing exceptional home health care, emphasizing personalized plans and the well-being of each client. Their dedicated team offers comprehensive services to ensure seniors live comfortably and with dignity at home. For more details, visit https://astirhc.com Bloomfield, NJ - Astir Home Health Care, a leading provider of home health care services, today announced its unwavering commitment to continue offering superior home health care in Bloomfield, NJ. Recognized for its dedication to quality and compassionate care, Astir Home Health Care ensures that families seeking home care in Bloomfield for their loved ones can access the support they need to live comfortably and with dignity in their homes. This ongoing service reflects the company's response to the growing demand for reliable, high-quality home care solutions in the region, emphasizing the importance of personalized care plans and the well-being of each individual.
“At Astir Home Health Care, we are deeply committed to the Bloomfield community. Our focus on providing exceptional home health care services is about more than just meeting the basic needs of our clients; it's about enriching their lives and offering peace of mind to their families,” said Cynthia Palmer, owner of Astir Home Health Care. “Our dedication to this mission is stronger than ever as we continue to adapt to the evolving needs of our community, ensuring that every individual and family we serve receives the personalized, compassionate care they deserve.”
Astir Home Health Care's approach to home health care is tailored to meet each client's unique needs, ranging from daily living assistance to more complex health care requirements. This personalized approach ensures that every client enjoys a higher quality of life, with services designed to foster independence, provide comfort, and enhance overall well-being.
Families in Bloomfield, NJ, looking for top-tier home health care services can rely on Astir Home Health Care for their loved ones' needs.
For more information about Astir Home Health Care and their home health care in Bloomfield, NJ , please visit their website at https://astirhc.com
About Astir Home Health Care:
Astir Home Health Care is a premier provider of home health care services in Bloomfield, NJ. With a reputation for excellence and a team of dedicated health care professionals, Astir Home Health Care offers a comprehensive range of services designed to meet the diverse needs of the elderly community. Committed to enhancing the lives of seniors and their families, Astir Home Health Care remains a leading choice for those seeking quality, compassionate care in the comfort of their own homes.

author: Jason Easley
title: Karine Jean-Pierre Humiliates GOP Zelenskyy Investigation Hypocrites
text: Last updated on September 29th, 2024 at 11:07 am White House Press Secretary Karine Jean-Pierre pointed out that there were no Republican calls for an investigation after Zelenskyy visited a weapons plant in Utah. The White House Press Secretary was asked, “And then critics have said that Zelensky’s trip to Pennsylvania was a political stunt. Did the administration communicate at all with Ukraine on who would be attending that trip, or make any effort to make it a bipartisan event?” Pierre answered: So, let me just lay this down, because I know that there’s been a lot of talk about this. So the Ukrainians asked to visit the facility, which employs American workers, as who are manufacturing critical supplies that the Ukrainian military is using every day on the front lines of freedom. Because of its centrality of the, of their, to their country’s continued existence, this came from Ukrainian, not us. This is something that they wanted to do. After they made that request, DOD did what it has done for years, figure out how to provide transportation for foreign leaders traveling on US soil, which is common, which happens when they come to the U. S., and the whole world knows this is someone Putin wants dead. He’s made very clear. When it comes to President Zelensky. Also, just two months ago, President Zelensky traveled to Utah and held an event with a Republican governor, a very similar event, and Republican officials were there at that event in Utah, and there wasn’t a single demand, not one, not one single demand for an investigation when that occurred a couple months ago in Utah. So, this was business as usual. For a Ukrainian request during wartime, during wartime. And so I, I would encourage, we would encourage the House Republicans to drop this. These kind of, this is a political stunt, they need to drop this. And and anything else, any, I think I gave a lot here. A lot of lay a good layout of how this all occurred, but anything else specific, I would for I would certainly refer you to the DOD. The follow up question, “Just clarifying, though, that the administration didn’t or the campaign, didn’t play a role in determining the guest list because they’re they’re claiming that having no Republicans there in a battleground state made it effectively a campaign.” Pierre drove the point home, “This is something that Ukrainians asked for. They did this a couple months ago in Utah, in Utah, with a Republican governor. And Republican elected officials were there as well. We didn’t hear any type of investigation request when we went to a Republican state. We didn’t.” Video: KJP responds to GOP claims of Zelenskyy election interference, “President Zelensky traveled to Utah and held an event with a Republican governor, a very similar event, and Republican officials were there at that event, and there wasn’t not one single demand for an investigation.” [pic.twitter.com/3FPVK87g2n]— Sarah Reese Jones (@PoliticusSarah) [September 26, 2024] Speaker of the [House Mike Johnson and Trump accuse Zelenskyy of election interference](https://www.politicususa.com/2024/09/24/house-republicans-melt-down-and-demand-doj-investigation-of-zelenskyy-trip-to-pa.html) unless he goes to a red state with Republicans. The hypocrisy even for Trump’s Republican Party is off the charts, and Karine Jean-Pierre humiliated the GOP with the facts. To comment on this story, join us on [Reddit.](https://www.reddit.com/r/PoliticusUSA/) [see all](https://www.politicususa.com/author/jason-easley)) - [Calls Grow For DOJ To Appoint Special Counsel To Investigate Jared Kushner](https://www.politicususa.com/2024/10/24/doj-special-counsel-jared-kushner.html)- Thu, Oct 24th, 2024 - [Trump Brags About How Fast He Will Fire Jack Smith Thanks To The Supreme Court](https://www.politicususa.com/2024/10/24/trump-brags-about-how-fast-he-will-fire-jack-smith-thanks-to-the-supreme-court.html)- Thu, Oct 24th, 2024 - [It Looks Like Trump Is Beginning To Panic](https://www.politicususa.com/2024/10/24/it-looks-like-trump-is-beginning-to-panic.html)- Thu, Oct 24th, 2024

author: 北京商報
title: 知名餐飲品牌被曝後廚蟑螂橫行！成本5元漢堡賣15元 | 文學城
text:
店員回應：“有做消殺，但蟑螂繁殖太快。”
7月2日，據福建電視台報道，福建廈門牛約堡林後店後廚中有多種食材裸露，多隻蟑螂到處爬行。
該報道稱，牛約堡禾祥西路店在多個外賣平台月銷量均超1000單，號稱“堂食餐廳”，但現場僅有一個極小的桌台和兩張椅子。操作區漢堡烤台及設備表麵油汙和食物殘渣遍布，部分區域汙垢已凝結成塊，冰箱內火腿、牛肉餅裸露未密封。罐頭架上，四五隻蟑螂在爬行，甚至裝調料的碗中也有一隻蟑螂。
對此，店員僅回應：“我知道，有做消殺，但蟑螂繁殖太快。”
對此，有網友評論表示，太惡心了。
據九派新聞報道，牛約堡廈門林後店一工作人員表示，網上反映的情況不屬實，門店正常營業。其稱，門店剛開業不久，算是規模比較大的門店，有堂食。
牛約堡全國客服熱線工作人員回應稱，無法判斷報道內容是否屬實，正在核實處理，如果檢查出來有問題，會罰款。其稱，所報道內容可能性不大，因為每天都有監控查看門店操作規範，也會安排區域經理每周巡店，有不對的情況會要求整改。該工作人員同時表示，衛生檢查會按照QS標準，食材保質期也在檢查範圍內。
這並不是牛約堡第一次被曝光食品安全問題。2024年，牛約堡的食品安全問題也引發網友熱議，有媒體報道以“30多塊的牛約堡檔口老鼠遍地跑”為題，報道了寧波一家“牛約堡”漢堡店廚房監控中出現老鼠身影。
藍鯨新聞記者致電牛約堡招商客服，工作人員表示：“加盟合作費需要8.8萬元，雞肉漢堡成本5元，賣15元，牛肉漢堡成本7.3元，賣21元。對於加盟店管理問題，工作人員稱：一種是督導巡店，另一種是門店所有監控由總部監控部門管理查看。”
公開信息顯示，牛約堡創立於2018年，主打手作牛肉漢堡，同時還有雞肉、魚肉和素食等各類漢堡以及炸雞、薯條、小吃及飲品等。目前，牛約堡年銷量超4700萬個，全國155座城市擁有1800餘家門店。據南方都市報去年9月報道，記者走訪了廣州4家牛約堡門店，發現基本以外賣為主，通常開在城中村的巷子裏，一些門店環境比較簡陋，衛生狀況堪憂。
